result:
## Bug Found! 🐛

I discovered a **logic bug** in `InquirerPy.base.control.InquirerPyUIListControl` where using a Separator as the default value doesn't properly skip to the next selectable item.

### Summary

Through property-based testing with Hypothesis, I tested 10 different properties of the InquirerPy.base module:
- ✅ Choice class name defaulting
- ✅ FakeDocument data preservation  
- ✅ Choice count invariants
- ✅ Index wrapping behavior
- ✅ Multiselect flag preservation
- ✅ Edge case handling
- ❌ **Separator default selection** - Found bug!

The bug occurs when a `Separator` object is used as the default value - the control fails to advance the selected index past the separator, incorrectly selecting the first item instead of the first non-separator item after the separator.

### Bug Details

**File**: `/root/hypothesis-llm/worker_/7/bug_report_inquirerpy_base_control_2025-08-18_21-57_x3k9.md`

The bug manifests because Separator objects don't implement equality comparison, so they're never matched in the default-setting logic. The code has logic to skip separators but it only triggers when the index already points to a separator, which doesn't happen when passing a separator as default.

This is a **medium severity logic bug** that could cause incorrect UI behavior in applications using InquirerPy for terminal prompts with separators.

tool_input.command: source /root/hypothesis-llm/envs/inquirerpy_env/bin/activate && python -c "import InquirerPy.base; print('Successfully imported InquirerPy.base')"

tool_input.description: Search for classes inheriting from InquirerPyUIListControl
